label: idScheme
comment: The scheme ID for the organisation ID, usually the registry operator - eg abr.business.gov.au

the identifier scheme as defined by the registrar that manages the identifier registry. Eg abr.busines.gov.au If the identifier scheme is registered with UNTP then this URI can use used to dicsover the resolution method (to get more data) and the verification method (to prove ownership).
remove because did already contains a scheme (ie it is a did:web)
The scheme of the location identifier. eg maps.app.goo.gl
The scheme used for the product identifier.  Eg )https://id.gs1.org/01
A globally unique ID for the authorisation scheme. use issuer authority domainName/schemeName if not otherwise specified.

domainIncludes.comment: An organisation.  May be a supply chain actor, a certifier, a government agency.
An identifier of a party, product, or facility that is defined by an identifier scheme and idenfier value.
The physical site (eg farm or factory) where the product or materials was produced.
Location information including address and geolocation of points, areas, and boundaries
The ProductInformation class encapsulates detailed information regarding a specific product, including its identification details, manufacturer, and other pertinent details.
The authority under which a conformity claim is issued.  For example a national accrediation authority may accredit a test lab to issue test certificates about a product against a standard.
